intro: Lysimachia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable willowherb, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and North America. It is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, which can range from oval to needle-like, depending on environmental conditions. The plant typically grows in moist, shady habitats such as woodland floors and stream banks. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. Lysimachia heterophylla is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
